title: Joe Giudice's stunning weight loss due to 'working out and no drinking' while in federal prison
text:
He underwent an impressive physical transformation while serving his time behind bars in federal prison.

Joe Giudice spent three years in prison before his release in March and was then held in ICE detention pending deportation to Italy where he was born.

'He lost the weight from changing his diet, working out and no drinking,' a source explained to People Tuesday.

Healthier: Joe Giudice, 47, stunned RHONJ fans with his trimmer and fitter physique following his release from ICE custody Friday (left). A source told People that Joe, pictured right in 2015, 'lost the weight from changing his diet, working out and no drinking'

Joe, 47, is now back in Italy after he asked to be released while awaiting a final decision on his appeal against deportation.

Although the father of four came to the US as a child, he never became a citizen and his 2014 conviction on charges of mail, wire and bankruptcy fraud rendered him a felon and as such, revoked his permanent resident status.

He left the US for Italy on Friday and photos of him shared on social media by his family show him trimmer and fitter.

Just before beginning his 41-month sentence, Joe told People that he had been drinking 'a couple of bottles at night' and couldn't recall when he had last had an alcohol-free day.

Drinker: Just before beginning his 41-month sentence, Joe told People that he had been drinking 'a couple of bottles at night' and couldn't recall when he had last had an alcohol-free day. He's seen with wife Teresa on March 5, 2016, two weeks before going to prison

Family reunion: Joe is now back in Italy after he asked to be released while awaiting a final decision on his appeal against deportation. He's seen alongside his brother Pete

His wife Teresa revealed in September 2016 that Joe had dropped 35 pounds during his first six months at the penitentiary in Allenwood, Pennsylvania.

'He’s running, he’s doing 1,000 sit-ups a day,' she told People. 'So he lifts weights and that’s what he’s doing. Just running, working out and then a lot of push-ups and sit-ups. He’s doing over 1,000 sit-ups.'

Joe and Teresa share four daughters - Gia, 18, Gabriella, 15, Milania, 14, and Audriana, 10.

Joe's attorney James J. Leonard Jr. has said that Joe is 'extremely happy to be released' from ICE custody and that they will continue to battle the deportation order.
